item.title: Service Providors and Big Brother Wag Each Others Tails Again
item.description: I love how there is all of this squabbling about what the definition of broadband is. “The Commission should continue to look at maximum advertised speed rather than some measure of ‘actual’ speed,” and consumers have “access to broadband capability” whenever they have the opportunity to purchase services and equipment that enable them to access the Internet at any time and use the types of applications that are most commonly used today, such as e-mail and web browsing.
